chapter.title: Installing sle2docker
chapter.para: The sle2docker is used to import pre-built &sle; images. The imported pre-built images can be then used to create base docker images.

note.para: If you intend to create a base docker image from scratch as described in the , you don't have to install the sle2docker tool.

chapter.para: The tool is part of the official container module. You can install it by using zypper. But prior to installing sle2docker, verify that the following prerequisites are fulfilled: docker daemon is running on the system.

listitem.para: Ruby is installed on the host machine.
The docker daemon is running on the system.
The user invoking sle2docker must have proper rights to invoke docker commands
